current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the use of force against the organization called the Islamic State in order to defend
			 the American people and assist the Iraqi Government in expelling the
			 Islamic State from their territory.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following joint resolution; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Authorization for Use of Force Against the Organization Called the Islamic State
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Force Against the Organization Called the Islamic State

text.#text: This joint resolution may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorization for use of United States Armed Forces

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to use all necessary and appropriate force in order to
			 defend the national security of the United States against the threat posed
			 by the organization called the Islamic State (or

quote.#tail:
), formally known as the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, as well as any successor
			 organization.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the Congress declares that this
			 section is intended to constitute specific statutory authorization within
			 the meaning of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 8(a)(1) of the War Powers Resolution
section 5(b) of the War Powers Resolution

text.#text: Nothing in this joint resolution supercedes any requirement of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a written report setting forth a comprehensive
			 strategy of the United States to defeat the organization called the
			 Islamic State, as well as any successor organization, by using all
			 appropriate military, economic, and political capabilities of the United
			 States.

text.#text: Not later than 15 days after the date of the enactment of this joint resolution, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Force Against the Organization Called the Islamic State/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a written report
			 setting forth a current comprehensive description and assessment of the
			 implementation of the strategy set forth in the report required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for Use of Force Against the Organization Called the Islamic State/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
makes a substantive change to the
			 comprehensive strategy, the

will immediately submit a written
			 report to

which articulates the change, the reason for the change
			 and the change’s effect on the rest of the comprehensive strategy.

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after the submittal of the report required by

quote.#tail: , formerly known as the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, has murdered United States citizens;

text.#text: Whereas the organization called the Islamic State or

quote.#text: [t]he war with you has just begun

text.#text:
Whereas IS has threatened to kill United States citizens and the current leader of IS has stated
			 that

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the Prime Minister of United Kingdom have jointly
			 confirmed the threat posed by IS fighters returning to allied nations and
			 American shores by stating that

quote.#text:
[w]hether it is regional aggression going unchecked or the prospect that foreign fighters could
			 return from Iraq and Syria to pose a threat in our countries, the problems
			 we face today threaten the security of the British and American people,
			 and the wider world
as sophisticated and well-funded as any group that we have seen. …
… an imminent threat to every interest we have, whether it’s in Iraq or anywhere else. …

text.#text: Whereas Secretary of Defense Chuck Hagel has stated IS is

Whereas acts, such as the murder of United States citizens, and threats of other terrorist acts
			 render it both necessary and appropriate that the United States exercise
			 its rights to self-defense and to protect United States citizens both home
			 and abroad;

quote.#text:
the need to continue efforts to promote international and regional cooperation aimed at supporting
			 Iraq to prevent terrorist groups … in particular ISIL [IS], from using the
			 territories of Iraq and neighboring States to carry out violence or other
			 illicit acts to destabilize Iraq and the region …

text.#text: Whereas United Nations Security Council Resolution (

quote.#text:
heavy human causalities including children, the displacement of more than one million Iraqi
			 civilians and the threats against all religious and ethnic groups …

Whereas the Iraqi Government has requested the assistance of the United States: Now, therefore, be
